author: Staff Reporter
text:
Students of Panniandi community at the taluk office in Krishnagiri on Monday demanding community certificates.— Photo: N.Bashkaran

The Panniandi Samuga Nala Sangam has threatened poll boycott if its demand for community certificates is not met by the authorities in the district.

There are over 5,000 families and about 50,000 population of Panniandis in the district.

According to the Panniandi Association, between October and December 2014, over 340 applications for community certificates were given at all taluks of the district here. However, as on date, only 32 applications had been issued, and the remaining applications remained shelved. Only two certificates were issued in Denkanikottai; 11 in Hosur; 9 in Pochampalli and 10 certificates in Krishnagiri, the Sangam stated.

According to G.Gurumurthy, district secretary of the Sangam, even these community certificates were issued only after consistent protests by the community.

The authorities refused to consider applications, where the father of the applicant had been issued a certificate; and also where the immediate kin of the applicant had a certificate.

The long-pending demand was also derailed by the frequent change in respective tahsildars, he said. Students who would be completing school education were the worst affected without community certificates.

Alleging betrayal by the political parties in each elections, the Panniandi community has now declared poll boycott, if the authorities fail to heed to their demand before April 15.

Earlier, students of the Panniandi community arrived at the Krishnagiri taluk office with a petition.
title: Panniandi Nala Sangam threatens poll boycott
